Quotio: Stop Juggling AI Accounts - A macOS Menu Bar App That Unifies Claude, Gemini, OpenAI, Qwen, and Antigravity

Dec 28, 2025
Vibe Sparking

Quotio: Stop Juggling AI Accounts

Section titled ‚ÄúQuotio: Stop Juggling AI Accounts‚Äù

Stop juggling AI accounts. Quotio is a beautiful native macOS menu bar app that unifies your Claude, Gemini, OpenAI, Qwen, and Antigravity subscriptions ‚Äì with real-time quota tracking and smart auto-failover for AI coding tools like Claude Code, OpenCode, and Droid.

Introduction: The AI Account Management Problem

Section titled ‚ÄúIntroduction: The AI Account Management Problem‚Äù

As developers, we increasingly rely on multiple AI coding assistants in our daily work. You might use Claude Code for intelligent code completion, GitHub Copilot for inline suggestions, Cursor for AI-powered IDE features, and various OpenAI-based tools for different tasks. Each service comes with its own:

  • Subscription and billing
  • API keys and authentication
  • Usage quotas and rate limits
  • Separate dashboard and management interface

This fragmentation creates constant overhead. You‚Äôre juggling multiple browser tabs, switching between different CLI configurations, and inevitably hitting rate limits on one service while another sits idle. Enter Quotio ‚Äì a unified solution that brings all your AI subscriptions under one roof.

What is Quotio?

Section titled ‚ÄúWhat is Quotio?‚Äù

Quotio is a native macOS application that provides unified quota monitoring and request routing for multiple AI provider services. Created by developer Trong Nguyen (nguyenphutrong), Quotio serves two complementary purposes:

  1. Visual Dashboard ‚Äì Track all your AI API usage limits in one beautiful interface
  2. Optional Local Proxy ‚Äì Route requests across multiple provider accounts with intelligent load balancing and failover

Dual-Mode Architecture

Section titled ‚ÄúDual-Mode Architecture‚Äù

Quotio offers two operation modes to suit different needs:

Quota-Only Mode

Section titled ‚ÄúQuota-Only Mode‚Äù

A lightweight mode perfect for users who simply want visibility into their AI usage:

  • Real-time quota tracking by reading authentication files from installed CLI tools
  • Support for Claude Code, Codex CLI, Gemini CLI, GitHub Copilot, Cursor, and Antigravity
  • macOS menu bar integration for at-a-glance quota status
  • System notifications for low quota warnings
  • No proxy server required ‚Äì minimal resource footprint

Full Mode

Section titled ‚ÄúFull Mode‚Äù

All Quota-Only features plus powerful proxy capabilities:

  • Local proxy server for request routing and load balancing
  • OAuth-based provider authentication
  • Automatic failover between accounts when quotas are exhausted
  • API key management for secure proxy access
  • Comprehensive usage statistics and request logging
  • Automatic configuration of CLI agents to use the proxy

Core Features

Section titled ‚ÄúCore Features‚Äù

1. Multi-Provider Support

Section titled ‚Äú1. Multi-Provider Support‚Äù

Quotio unifies 10 AI providers in a single interface:

ProviderQuota-Only ModeFull Mode
Claude‚úÖ‚úÖ
Gemini‚úÖ‚úÖ
OpenAI‚úÖ‚úÖ
Qwen‚úÖ‚úÖ
Antigravity‚úÖ‚úÖ
GitHub Copilot‚úÖ‚úÖ
Cursor‚úÖ‚úÖ
Codex CLI‚úÖ‚úÖ

2. Real-Time Quota Tracking

Section titled ‚Äú2. Real-Time Quota Tracking‚Äù

The menu bar integration provides at-a-glance quota status:

  • Provider symbol (1-2 letters) + lowest percentage across models
  • Example: "G:95% C:42% CP:88%" (Gemini 95%, Claude 42%, Copilot 88%)
  • Color-coded indicators: green (>50%), orange (20-50%), red (<20%)
  • Customizable display options ‚Äì show/hide providers, change color modes

3. Smart Auto-Failover

Section titled ‚Äú3. Smart Auto-Failover‚Äù

In Full Mode, Quotio acts as an intelligent proxy:

When one account hits its quota limit, Quotio automatically routes requests to another available account, ensuring uninterrupted workflow.

4. Menu Bar Integration

Section titled ‚Äú4. Menu Bar Integration‚Äù

The persistent macOS menu bar presence keeps you informed without interrupting your workflow:

  • Always-visible quota status
  • Quick access to detailed dashboard
  • Low quota notifications
  • Language support: English and Vietnamese

Installation and Setup

Section titled ‚ÄúInstallation and Setup‚Äù

Prerequisites

Section titled ‚ÄúPrerequisites‚Äù
  • macOS 14.6 or later
  • Accounts with supported AI providers (Claude, Gemini, OpenAI, etc.)

Getting Started

Section titled ‚ÄúGetting Started‚Äù
  1. Download Quotio from the GitHub Releases page
  2. Launch the app and complete the onboarding flow
  3. Choose your mode: Quota-Only (lightweight) or Full (with proxy)
  4. Connect your accounts via OAuth or manual authentication
  5. Configure your coding tools to use the Quotio proxy (Full Mode)

Agent Configuration

Section titled ‚ÄúAgent Configuration‚Äù

For AI coding tools, Quotio provides automatic configuration:

Use Cases and Best Practices

Section titled ‚ÄúUse Cases and Best Practices‚Äù

For Individual Developers

Section titled ‚ÄúFor Individual Developers‚Äù

Scenario: You‚Äôre a developer using Claude Code for daily work, but you also have access to Gemini and OpenAI APIs for side projects.

Solution: Quotio lets you see all your quotas at a glance and automatically routes requests when one provider is exhausted.

For Teams

Section titled ‚ÄúFor Teams‚Äù

Scenario: Your team has multiple AI subscriptions across different providers, and team members frequently hit rate limits during peak hours.

Solution: Configure Quotio with multiple accounts per provider for intelligent load distribution and automatic failover.

For Cost Optimization

Section titled ‚ÄúFor Cost Optimization‚Äù

Scenario: You want to maximize usage of your AI subscriptions before upgrading to higher tiers.

Solution: Use Quotio‚Äôs detailed usage statistics to understand consumption patterns and make informed decisions about subscription upgrades.

Technical Architecture

Section titled ‚ÄúTechnical Architecture‚Äù

Built with modern macOS development practices:

  • Framework: SwiftUI with AppKit integration
  • Architecture: MVVM with Actor Model for thread-safe services
  • Concurrency: Swift Concurrency (async/await, actors)
  • Localization: English and Vietnamese support
  • Auto-Updates: Sparkle framework for seamless updates

The project structure follows clean architecture principles:

Comparison with Alternatives

Section titled ‚ÄúComparison with Alternatives‚Äù
FeatureQuotioManual ManagementOther Solutions
Multi-Provider Support‚úÖ 10+ providers‚ùå One at a time‚ö†Ô∏è Limited
Real-Time Quota Tracking‚úÖ Menu bar + dashboard‚ùå Browser tabs only‚ö†Ô∏è Often delayed
Auto-Failover‚úÖ Intelligent routing‚ùå Manual switching‚ö†Ô∏è Basic routing
Native macOS App‚úÖ Menu bar integration‚ùå Web-based‚ö†Ô∏è Electron bloat
Open Source‚úÖ Fully open sourceN/A‚ùå Often proprietary
Offline Capable‚úÖ Works without internet‚ùå Requires internet‚ö†Ô∏è Limited

Future Roadmap

Section titled ‚ÄúFuture Roadmap‚Äù

As of version 0.2.2, Quotio is actively developed with recent additions including:

  • Quota-Only Mode for lightweight usage
  • Cursor support
  • Enhanced proxy management
  • Internationalization support

Check the CHANGELOG.md for the latest updates.

Conclusion

Section titled ‚ÄúConclusion‚Äù

Quotio solves a real pain point for developers who use multiple AI services. By providing unified quota monitoring, intelligent request routing, and seamless failover, it transforms the fragmented experience of managing multiple AI subscriptions into a cohesive, productive workflow.

Whether you‚Äôre an individual developer juggling personal AI subscriptions or part of a team with multiple provider accounts, Quotio offers the tools you need to maximize your AI productivity.

Download Quotio today: github.com/nguyenphutrong/quotio

References

Section titled ‚ÄúReferences‚Äù
  • Quotio GitHub Repository
  • Reddit Announcement
  • Developer Profile
Tags:
  • AI
  • macOS
  • Developer Tools
  • Claude Code
  • Productivity

Claude Code Board: Use Claude Code on Kanban WebUI

Dec 26, 2025
Vibe Sparking

Introduction

Section titled ‚ÄúIntroduction‚Äù

Claude Code Board is a web-based Kanban-style management interface designed specifically for the Claude Code CLI. If you are a power user of Claude Code, you might find yourself juggling multiple terminal windows to handle different tasks concurrently. Claude Code Board solves this by providing a unified, visual interface to manage these sessions.

It aims to enhance the developer experience by allowing concurrent management of multiple AI coding sessions with real-time status tracking (idle, processing, completed, error).

Features

Section titled ‚ÄúFeatures‚Äù

Multi-Session Management

Section titled ‚ÄúMulti-Session Management‚Äù

Run multiple Claude Code instances simultaneously. The Kanban board allows you to see the status of each session at a glance‚Äîwhether it‚Äôs idle, processing, or completed.

Advanced AI Workflows

Section titled ‚ÄúAdvanced AI Workflows‚Äù
  • Agent Integration: Load custom Claude agents directly from your ~/.claude/agents/ directory.
  • Workflow Stages: Utilize pre-configured stages like Code Review, Bug Fixing, and Feature Development to structure your work.
  • Smart Prompting: Automatically inject agent instructions and custom templates to streamline your interaction with the AI.

Project Organization

Section titled ‚ÄúProject Organization‚Äù

Group your sessions under ‚ÄúWork Items,‚Äù tag them by project or topic, and automatically manage workspace paths. This keeps your work organized conceptually, not just by terminal ID.

Enhanced UI/UX

Section titled ‚ÄúEnhanced UI/UX‚Äù
  • WebSocket-powered chat: Real-time updates and interaction.
  • Notifications: Windows Toast notifications alert you when a task is completed.
  • Message Filtering: Filter out ‚Äúthinking‚Äù blocks or tool use logs to focus on the conversation and results.
  • Session Recovery: Resume previous conversations with full context preservation.

Prerequisites and Installation

Section titled ‚ÄúPrerequisites and Installation‚Äù

Prerequisites

Section titled ‚ÄúPrerequisites‚Äù
  • Operating System: Windows 10/11
  • Runtime: Node.js (v18+)
  • Core Tool: Claude Code CLI installed globally (npm install -g @anthropic-ai/claude-code)

Installation Steps

Section titled ‚ÄúInstallation Steps‚Äù

  1. Clone the Repository

  2. Install Dependencies You need to install dependencies for the root, backend, and frontend.

  3. Start the Application

    • Option 1 (Windows): Simply run start.bat.
    • Option 2 (Manual): Run npm run dev:backend and npm run dev:frontend in separate terminals.

  4. Access: Open your browser and navigate to http://localhost:5173.

Usage Scenarios

Section titled ‚ÄúUsage Scenarios‚Äù

Concurrent Development

Section titled ‚ÄúConcurrent Development‚Äù

Imagine you are working on a feature, but you also need to fix a critical bug and review a PR. Instead of opening three terminals and losing track of context, you can create three cards on the Claude Code Board: ‚ÄúFeature X‚Äù, ‚ÄúBug Y‚Äù, and ‚ÄúPR Review Z‚Äù. You can switch between them easily and see their progress.

Agent-Based Workflows

Section titled ‚ÄúAgent-Based Workflows‚Äù

You can configure specialized agents (e.g., an ‚ÄúArchitect‚Äù agent or a ‚ÄúDebugger‚Äù agent) by creating .md files in your agents directory. When starting a session, you can select the specific agent best suited for the task.

Precautions

Section titled ‚ÄúPrecautions‚Äù
  • Security: This tool is designed for local/personal use only. It does not have enterprise-grade security (encryption/auth) and should not be deployed to public networks.
  • Platform: Currently optimized for Windows.

Reference Links

Section titled ‚ÄúReference Links‚Äù
  • Claude Code Board GitHub Repository
Tags:
  • ai
  • claude-code
  • kanban
  • productivity
  • webui

AntVis Infographic: Bring Words to Life with AI-Powered Visualization

Dec 25, 2025
Vibe Sparking

The Challenge: From Data to Visual Storytelling

Section titled ‚ÄúThe Challenge: From Data to Visual Storytelling‚Äù

Creating professional infographics has always been a time-consuming process. Designers spend hours in tools like Figma, Illustrator, or Canva, manually arranging elements, adjusting colors, and ensuring visual consistency.

For developers and data scientists, the gap between raw data and compelling visual narratives feels even wider. You have the information ‚Äî but turning it into something shareable and engaging requires skills that extend beyond code.

What if you could generate beautiful infographics with just text and data?

Enter AntV Infographic ‚Äî Ant Group‚Äôs open-source, declarative infographic visualization engine that makes professional visual content creation accessible to everyone.

What is AntV Infographic?

Section titled ‚ÄúWhat is AntV Infographic?‚Äù

AntV Infographic is a next-generation declarative infographic visualization engine from the AntV team (part of Ant Group). With a carefully designed infographic syntax, it can quickly and flexibly render high-quality infographics, making information presentation more efficient and data storytelling simpler.

The framework is built with AI-native workflows in mind ‚Äî its syntax is optimized for large language model generation, and it supports real-time streaming rendering.

Key metrics:

  • 200+ built-in templates for immediate use
  • SVG output for pixel-perfect quality at any size
  • MIT licensed and fully open source

Core Features

Section titled ‚ÄúCore Features‚Äù

AI-Friendly Design

Section titled ‚ÄúAI-Friendly Design‚Äù

The configuration and syntax are specifically tuned for AI generation:

  • Concise prompts that LLMs can understand and produce
  • Fault-tolerant parsing that handles partial or imperfect output
  • Streaming support for real-time progressive rendering

Ready-to-Use Components

Section titled ‚ÄúReady-to-Use Components‚Äù

With ~200 built-in templates, data-item components, and layouts, you can build professional infographics in minutes:

Component TypeExamples
ListsHorizontal arrows, vertical timelines, comparison grids
ChartsPie, bar, line, radar integrated with narrative
DiagramsProcess flows, org charts, mind maps
Data ItemsStatistics, KPI cards, progress indicators

Theme System

Section titled ‚ÄúTheme System‚Äù

Multiple preset themes with deep customization options:

  • Hand-drawn style for informal, approachable content
  • Gradient themes for modern, dynamic presentations
  • Pattern-based themes for visual texture
  • Corporate presets for professional reports

Built-in Editor

Section titled ‚ÄúBuilt-in Editor‚Äù

AI-generated results can be edited further with the included WYSIWYG editor ‚Äî no separate design tool required.

High-Quality SVG Output

Section titled ‚ÄúHigh-Quality SVG Output‚Äù

Renders with SVG by default to ensure:

  • Visual fidelity at any zoom level
  • Easy editing in vector tools
  • Small file sizes compared to raster images
  • Accessibility through structured markup

The Infographic Syntax

Section titled ‚ÄúThe Infographic Syntax‚Äù

AntV Infographic uses a declarative, human-readable syntax that‚Äôs optimized for both human writing and AI generation:

This simple syntax produces a professional horizontal arrow flow diagram with labeled steps ‚Äî no design skills required.

Use Cases

Section titled ‚ÄúUse Cases‚Äù

AI-Generated Reports

Section titled ‚ÄúAI-Generated Reports‚Äù

Feed data to an LLM with the infographic prompt, and receive streaming visual output:

Real-Time Dashboards

Section titled ‚ÄúReal-Time Dashboards‚Äù

Because the syntax is declarative and renders progressively, you can:

  • Update infographics as data changes
  • Stream AI analysis results directly to visuals
  • Build interactive data exploration tools

Educational Content

Section titled ‚ÄúEducational Content‚Äù

Create engaging learning materials:

  • Process explanations with visual flows
  • Comparison tables with design polish
  • Statistics with contextual visualization

Business Presentations

Section titled ‚ÄúBusiness Presentations‚Äù

Replace slide design time with automated generation:

  • KPI summaries
  • Timeline visualizations
  • Organizational charts
  • Product comparison matrices

Getting Started

Section titled ‚ÄúGetting Started‚Äù

Installation

Section titled ‚ÄúInstallation‚Äù

Basic Usage

Section titled ‚ÄúBasic Usage‚Äù

Explore Templates

Section titled ‚ÄúExplore Templates‚Äù

Visit the Gallery to browse available templates and find starting points for your projects.

AI Agent Integration

Section titled ‚ÄúAI Agent Integration‚Äù

The project includes an AI Agent interface where you can:

  1. Describe what you want in natural language
  2. Watch the infographic generate in real-time (streaming)
  3. Edit the result with the built-in editor
  4. Export as SVG or other formats

For developers building AI applications, the prompt.md file provides optimized system prompts for LLM integration.

About AntV

Section titled ‚ÄúAbout AntV‚Äù

AntV was initiated by Ant Group and open-sourced starting in 2017, reimagining data visualization by embedding the theory of graphical grammar into JavaScript.

The AntV ecosystem includes:

  • G2 ‚Äî A grammar of graphics for statistical charts
  • G6 ‚Äî Graph visualization engine
  • L7 ‚Äî Geospatial visualization
  • S2 ‚Äî Spreadsheet-like visualization
  • Infographic ‚Äî AI-native infographic generation

Comparison with Alternatives

Section titled ‚ÄúComparison with Alternatives‚Äù
FeatureAntV InfographicCanvaD3.jsMermaid
AI-native syntaxYesNoNoNo
Streaming renderingYesNoNoNo
Built-in templates200+ExtensiveNoneLimited
DeclarativeYesNoPartialYes
SVG outputDefaultExportDefaultSVG
Self-hostableYesNoYesYes
Learning curveLowLowHighLow
EditabilityBuilt-in editorYesCodeCode

Community & Resources

Section titled ‚ÄúCommunity & Resources‚Äù
  • Website: infographic.antv.vision
  • Documentation: Learn
  • Gallery: Examples
  • GitHub: antvis/Infographic
  • Discussions: GitHub Discussions

The Bottom Line

Section titled ‚ÄúThe Bottom Line‚Äù

AntV Infographic represents a significant step forward in making data visualization accessible to both developers and AI systems.

For developers: It provides a declarative syntax that eliminates the need for design skills while producing professional output.

For AI builders: The streaming-compatible, fault-tolerant syntax makes it ideal for LLM-generated visual content.

For organizations: The MIT license and self-hosting options provide flexibility without vendor lock-in.

If you‚Äôre building anything that involves presenting data visually ‚Äî reports, dashboards, presentations, or AI-generated content ‚Äî AntV Infographic deserves a place in your toolkit.

Resources:

  • Website: infographic.antv.vision
  • GitHub: antvis/Infographic
  • NPM: @antv/infographic
  • License: MIT
Tags:
  • AntV
  • Infographic
  • Data Visualization

  • Open Source
  • SVG
  • Ant Group

Clawdis: Your Personal AI Assistant on WhatsApp, Telegram & Web

Dec 25, 2025
Vibe Sparking

Clawdis: Your Personal AI Assistant on WhatsApp, Telegram & Web

Section titled ‚ÄúClawdis: Your Personal AI Assistant on WhatsApp, Telegram & Web‚Äù

ü¶û EXFOLIATE! EXFOLIATE! ‚Äî That‚Äôs the playful battlecry of Clawdis, an open-source personal AI assistant created by Peter Steinberger (@steipete). Unlike cloud-hosted AI services, Clawdis runs on your own devices, connecting to the messaging platforms you already use daily: WhatsApp, Telegram, and Web.

What is Clawdis?

Section titled ‚ÄúWhat is Clawdis?‚Äù

Clawdis is a local-first control plane for your personal AI assistant. Think of it as the infrastructure that lets you interact with an AI agent through:

  • WhatsApp ‚Äî Send a message, get an intelligent response
  • Telegram ‚Äî Bot-based conversations via the Telegram Bot API
  • WebChat ‚Äî Browser-based interface for desktop use
  • macOS app ‚Äî Menu bar control with voice wake and push-to-talk
  • iOS node ‚Äî Canvas surface with voice trigger forwarding

The name ‚ÄúClawdis‚Äù is a clever portmanteau: CLAW + TARDIS ‚Äî because every space lobster needs a time-and-space machine!

Key Features

Section titled ‚ÄúKey Features‚Äù

1. Multi-Surface Inbox

Section titled ‚Äú1. Multi-Surface Inbox‚Äù

Clawdis brings your AI assistant to wherever you already communicate. No need to switch to a dedicated app ‚Äî just message from WhatsApp or Telegram, and your assistant responds.

2. Voice Wake & Push-to-Talk

Section titled ‚Äú2. Voice Wake & Push-to-Talk‚Äù

On macOS and iOS, Clawdis supports:

  • Voice wake ‚Äî Say the wake word and start talking
  • Push-to-talk overlay ‚Äî Quick voice interactions
  • Local speech recognition ‚Äî Privacy-preserving, on-device processing

3. Live Canvas

Section titled ‚Äú3. Live Canvas‚Äù

A visual workspace that you can control from the agent. The Canvas renders live content and supports A2UI (Agent-to-UI) communication for rich interactive experiences.

4. Automation-Ready

Section titled ‚Äú4. Automation-Ready‚Äù

Clawdis comes with built-in capabilities for:

  • Browser control ‚Äî Automate web interactions
  • Media handling ‚Äî Process images, audio, and video
  • Tool streaming ‚Äî Real-time tool execution feedback
  • Smart home integration ‚Äî Philips Hue, Eight Sleep, and more

5. Local-First Architecture

Section titled ‚Äú5. Local-First Architecture‚Äù

The Gateway (control plane) owns all state and runs locally. Everything else ‚Äî nodes, surfaces, and integrations ‚Äî connects to it:

Quick Start

Section titled ‚ÄúQuick Start‚Äù

Prerequisites

Section titled ‚ÄúPrerequisites‚Äù
  • Node.js 22+
  • pnpm package manager

Installation

Section titled ‚ÄúInstallation‚Äù

Configuration

Section titled ‚ÄúConfiguration‚Äù

Create ~/.clawdis/clawdis.json:

Chat Commands

Section titled ‚ÄúChat Commands‚Äù

Use these commands in WhatsApp, Telegram, or WebChat:

CommandDescription
/statusHealth and session info
/new or /resetReset the session
/think <level>Set thinking level (off/minimal/low/medium/high)
/verbose on/offToggle verbose mode
/restartRestart the gateway (owner-only)
/activation mention/alwaysGroup activation toggle

Meet Clawd: The Space Lobster

Section titled ‚ÄúMeet Clawd: The Space Lobster‚Äù

Clawdis was built for Clawd ü¶û, Peter Steinberger‚Äôs AI assistant. Clawd is described as:

‚ÄúClaude with a ‚Äòw‚Äô and a lobster emoji.‚Äù

Running on Claude Opus 4.5 from a Mac Studio in Vienna, Clawd embodies four core values:

  1. Pragmatic Helpfulness ‚Äî Focus on efficient problem-solving
  2. Honest & Direct ‚Äî Candid feedback, willing to disagree
  3. Friendship ‚Äî Collaborative partnership, not just a tool
  4. Learn & Grow ‚Äî Embrace mistakes as learning opportunities

Use Cases

Section titled ‚ÄúUse Cases‚Äù

Daily Workflow Assistant

Section titled ‚ÄúDaily Workflow Assistant‚Äù
  • Send a WhatsApp message: ‚ÄúShip checklist for my iOS app‚Äù
  • Clawd checks your project, runs tests, and reports status

Smart Home Control

Section titled ‚ÄúSmart Home Control‚Äù
  • ‚ÄúTurn off all lights except the bedroom‚Äù
  • ‚ÄúSet the bedroom temperature to 68¬∞F‚Äù

Email Triage

Section titled ‚ÄúEmail Triage‚Äù

Browser Automation

Section titled ‚ÄúBrowser Automation‚Äù

Enable browser control in your config:

Comparison with Other Solutions

Section titled ‚ÄúComparison with Other Solutions‚Äù
FeatureClawdisChatGPT AppTraditional Bots
Local-first‚úÖ‚ùå‚ùå
WhatsApp integration‚úÖ‚ùåVaries
Telegram integration‚úÖ‚ùå‚úÖ
Voice wake (macOS/iOS)‚úÖ‚ùå‚ùå
Canvas/visual workspace‚úÖ‚ùå‚ùå
Open-source‚úÖ‚ùåVaries
Custom agent/skills‚úÖLimitedVaries

Agent Workspace & Skills

Section titled ‚ÄúAgent Workspace & Skills‚Äù

Clawdis supports a skill-based architecture:

  • Workspace root: ~/clawd (configurable)
  • Injected prompts: AGENTS.md, SOUL.md, TOOLS.md
  • Skills directory: ~/clawd/skills/<skill>/SKILL.md

macOS App

Section titled ‚ÄúmacOS App‚Äù

The macOS app is the command center:

  • Menu bar control for Gateway health
  • Voice Wake with push-to-talk overlay
  • WebChat and debug tools
  • Remote gateway control over SSH

Build and run:

Security Considerations

Section titled ‚ÄúSecurity Considerations‚Äù
  • Allowlisting: Restrict who can interact with your assistant via routing.allowFrom
  • Local-first: Gateway runs on 127.0.0.1 by default
  • Credentials storage: WhatsApp session stored in ~/.clawdis/credentials
  • Bridge security: Optional TCP bridge with pairing for mobile nodes

FAQ

Section titled ‚ÄúFAQ‚Äù

Q: What AI model does Clawdis use?

Section titled ‚ÄúQ: What AI model does Clawdis use?‚Äù

Clawdis is agent-agnostic but was designed around Pi (an RPC-based agent runtime) and commonly uses Claude models. You can configure your preferred AI provider.

Q: Can I use Clawdis for team/business use?

Section titled ‚ÄúQ: Can I use Clawdis for team/business use?‚Äù

Clawdis is designed as a single-user, personal assistant. For multi-user scenarios, you‚Äôd need to run separate instances.

Q: Is WhatsApp integration against their ToS?

Section titled ‚ÄúQ: Is WhatsApp integration against their ToS?‚Äù

Clawdis uses the WhatsApp Web protocol via Baileys. Use responsibly and at your own risk.

Q: How do I add custom skills?

Section titled ‚ÄúQ: How do I add custom skills?‚Äù

Create a new folder in ~/clawd/skills/<skill-name>/ with a SKILL.md file describing the skill‚Äôs capabilities and instructions.

Troubleshooting

Section titled ‚ÄúTroubleshooting‚Äù

WhatsApp connection issues

Section titled ‚ÄúWhatsApp connection issues‚Äù

Gateway won‚Äôt start

Section titled ‚ÄúGateway won‚Äôt start‚Äù

Check if port 18789 is in use:

iOS node won‚Äôt connect

Section titled ‚ÄúiOS node won‚Äôt connect‚Äù

Ensure the Bridge is running and both devices are on the same network.

References

Section titled ‚ÄúReferences‚Äù
  • GitHub Repository: steipete/clawdis
  • Documentation: clawdis.ai
  • Clawd‚Äôs Homepage: clawd.me
  • Peter Steinberger: steipete.me
  • Hacker News Discussion: Clawdis on HN

Clawdis represents an exciting approach to personal AI assistants ‚Äî local-first, multi-platform, and deeply integrated with your daily communication tools. If you‚Äôre looking for a private, always-on AI companion that respects your data sovereignty while delivering powerful capabilities, give Clawdis a try.

ü¶û Happy chatting with your space lobster assistant!

Slidev-AI: From Ideas to Professional Presentations with LLM Magic

Dec 25, 2025
Vibe Sparking

Slidev-AI: Transform Ideas into Professional Presentations with AI

Creating presentations has always been a time-consuming task‚Äîdesigning layouts, formatting content, and ensuring visual consistency. Slidev-AI changes the game by leveraging LLM technology to generate elegant, developer-friendly presentations from natural language descriptions.

1. What is Slidev-AI?

Section titled ‚Äú1. What is Slidev-AI?‚Äù

Slidev-AI is an open-source web application that combines the power of Large Language Models (LLMs) with Slidev‚Äîa Markdown-based presentation framework beloved by developers. It received the Best Application Award in the ModelScope MCP&Agent Competition.

Core Value Proposition

Section titled ‚ÄúCore Value Proposition‚Äù

‚ÄúFrom ideas to presentations to content distribution ‚Äî our mission is to shorten the distance.‚Äù

Key Features:

  • Natural Language Input: Describe your presentation in plain English (or other languages)
  • Markdown-Based Output: Generates clean Slidev Markdown that‚Äôs version-controllable
  • Web-Native Presentations: Output is viewable in any web browser
  • Developer-Friendly: Built for engineers and academics who prefer content over flashy design
  • OpenMCP Integration: Part of the OpenMCP ecosystem for agent development

2. How Slidev-AI Works

Section titled ‚Äú2. How Slidev-AI Works‚Äù

Slidev-AI operates as part of the OpenMCP ecosystem, demonstrating how developers can build specialized AI agents.

Architecture Overview

Section titled ‚ÄúArchitecture Overview‚Äù

The system provides:

  • A NestJS backend API handling LLM requests
  • A Vue.js frontend for interactive slide creation
  • Real-time preview of generated presentations
  • Export capabilities for sharing

3. Getting Started

Section titled ‚Äú3. Getting Started‚Äù

Prerequisites

Section titled ‚ÄúPrerequisites‚Äù
  • Node.js (or Docker for containerized deployment)
  • OpenAI API key (or compatible LLM API)

Quick Start with Docker

Section titled ‚ÄúQuick Start with Docker‚Äù

Slidev-AI recommends Docker deployment with two containers:

  • Backend: NestJS API on port 3001 (SQLite + Puppeteer)
  • Frontend: Vite+Vue served by Nginx on port 8080

Step 1: Configure Environment

Create a .env file at the repository root:

Step 2: Build and Start

Step 3: Access

  • Frontend: http://localhost:8080
  • Backend API: http://localhost:3001/api

4. Best Practices and Use Cases

Section titled ‚Äú4. Best Practices and Use Cases‚Äù

Ideal Scenarios

Section titled ‚ÄúIdeal Scenarios‚Äù
Use CaseDescription
Technical TalksGenerate conference slides from talk outlines
Academic PresentationsCreate minimalist slides for research papers
Team StandupsQuick status updates with structured slides
DocumentationTurn docs into presentation format
Tutorial SeriesGenerate educational content slides

Workflow Example: Conference Talk

Section titled ‚ÄúWorkflow Example: Conference Talk‚Äù

Tips for Better Results

Section titled ‚ÄúTips for Better Results‚Äù
  1. Be Specific: Include section headers and key points you want covered
  2. Iterate: Refine prompts based on initial output
  3. Customize Themes: Slidev supports custom CSS themes
  4. Version Control: Store generated Markdown in Git

5. Comparison with Alternatives

Section titled ‚Äú5. Comparison with Alternatives‚Äù
FeatureSlidev-AITraditional PPTOther AI Tools
Input MethodNatural LanguageManual DesignVarious
Output FormatMarkdownBinary (.pptx)Binary/PDF
Version ControlGit-friendlyDifficultLimited
CustomizationFull CSS ControlLimitedLimited
Web-NativeYesNoSometimes
Open SourceYes (MIT)NoVaries

Why Choose Slidev-AI?

  • Developer-First: Markdown output fits developer workflows
  • OpenMCP Ecosystem: Extensible agent architecture
  • Community-Driven: Active development and support

6. FAQs and Troubleshooting

Section titled ‚Äú6. FAQs and Troubleshooting‚Äù

Frequently Asked Questions

Section titled ‚ÄúFrequently Asked Questions‚Äù

Q: Which LLM providers are supported? A: Any OpenAI-compatible API works. Configure via OPENAI_BASE_URL environment variable.

Q: Can I self-host? A: Yes! Docker deployment is fully supported with persistent volumes.

Q: Is my data safe? A: Slidev-AI runs locally. Your presentations stay on your infrastructure.

Q: Can I customize the output theme? A: Absolutely. Slidev supports full CSS theming.

Common Issues

Section titled ‚ÄúCommon Issues‚Äù
IssueSolution
Port 8080/3001 in useEdit docker-compose.yml ports section
API key errorsVerify .env file configuration
Puppeteer issuesCheck Docker container has sufficient memory

7. Reference Links

Section titled ‚Äú7. Reference Links‚Äù
  • GitHub Repository: LSTM-Kirigaya/slidev-ai
  • Live Demo: slidev.kirigaya.cn
  • OpenMCP Documentation: kirigaya.cn/openmcp
  • Slidev Framework: sli.dev
  • Video Demo: Bilibili Demo
  • QQ Community Group: OpenMCP Developer Group

Conclusion

Section titled ‚ÄúConclusion‚Äù

Slidev-AI represents a significant step forward in presentation creation for developers. By combining LLM intelligence with the elegance of Slidev, it removes the friction between ideas and polished presentations.

Whether you‚Äôre preparing for a conference talk, academic presentation, or team update, Slidev-AI helps you focus on content while AI handles the formatting.

Get started today: Clone the repository, configure your LLM API, and experience the future of presentation creation.

From ideas to presentations‚Äîshortened by AI.

  • AI
  • Presentation
  • Slidev
  • LLM
  • OpenMCP
  • Productivity

Banana-Slides: AI-Native PPT Generator - Create Professional Presentations with Natural Language

Dec 24, 2025
Vibe Sparking

Banana-Slides: AI-Native PPT Generator - The Future of ‚ÄúVibe PPT‚Äù

Section titled ‚ÄúBanana-Slides: AI-Native PPT Generator - The Future of ‚ÄúVibe PPT‚Äù‚Äù

üçå Create professional presentations with just one sentence - welcome to the era of AI-native PPT generation!

Introduction

Section titled ‚ÄúIntroduction‚Äù

Banana-Slides is an innovative, open-source AI-native PPT generator built on the nano banana pro üçå model. It represents a paradigm shift in presentation creation - moving from tedious manual design to natural language-driven generation. Whether you‚Äôre a non-designer needing quick professional presentations, an educator converting content to visual formats, or a business professional creating proposals rapidly, Banana-Slides offers a revolutionary approach to slide creation.

Key Highlights

Section titled ‚ÄúKey Highlights‚Äù
FeatureDescription
üéØ One-Sentence CreationGenerate complete presentations from a single idea
üìù Outline-Based GenerationStructure your content and let AI fill in the design
üó£Ô∏è Natural Language EditingModify slides by simply describing what you want
üìÑ Smart Content ParsingUpload PDF/DOCX/MD/TXT files for intelligent extraction
üé® Custom Template SupportUpload any template image for consistent branding
üì§ One-Click ExportExport to PPTX or PDF in 16:9 format

Why Banana-Slides?

Section titled ‚ÄúWhy Banana-Slides?‚Äù

Traditional presentation tools require extensive design skills and time investment. Banana-Slides changes this by:

  1. Eliminating Design Barriers: No need for design expertise - describe what you want in plain language
  2. Accelerating Creation: Turn hours of work into minutes
  3. Maintaining Consistency: AI ensures design coherence throughout your presentation
  4. Enabling Iteration: Modify specific regions through natural language commands

Features Deep Dive

Section titled ‚ÄúFeatures Deep Dive‚Äù

Multi-Path Creation Methods

Section titled ‚ÄúMulti-Path Creation Methods‚Äù

One-Sentence Generation Simply describe your presentation topic, and Banana-Slides generates a complete slide deck:

Outline-Based Creation Provide a structured outline, and AI fills in the visual design and content organization.

Page-by-Page Description For precise control, describe each slide individually and let AI handle the design.

Smart Content Processing

Section titled ‚ÄúSmart Content Processing‚Äù

Upload your existing documents (PDF, DOCX, Markdown, TXT) and Banana-Slides will:

  • Auto-parse content using intelligent extraction
  • Identify key points for slide highlights
  • Extract images and charts for visual enrichment
  • Structure information for optimal presentation flow

Natural Language Editing

Section titled ‚ÄúNatural Language Editing‚Äù

No more hunting through complex menus. Simply describe your changes:

  • ‚ÄúMake the title larger and center it‚Äù
  • ‚ÄúAdd a blue gradient background to slide 3‚Äù
  • ‚ÄúReplace the bullet points with icons‚Äù

Export Options

Section titled ‚ÄúExport Options‚Äù
  • PPTX Format: Full compatibility with PowerPoint for further editing
  • PDF Format: Ready for immediate sharing or printing
  • 16:9 Aspect Ratio: Optimized for modern displays and projectors

Target Users

Section titled ‚ÄúTarget Users‚Äù
User TypeUse Case
üìä Non-DesignersQuick professional presentations without design skills
üé® Design ProfessionalsLayout inspiration and rapid prototyping
üéì EducatorsConverting teaching materials to engaging visuals
üìö StudentsEfficient assignment and project presentations
üíº Business ProfessionalsRapid proposal and pitch deck creation

Technical Architecture

Section titled ‚ÄúTechnical Architecture‚Äù

Frontend Stack

Section titled ‚ÄúFrontend Stack‚Äù
  • React 18 with TypeScript for robust UI development
  • Vite 5 for lightning-fast builds
  • Zustand for efficient state management
  • Tailwind CSS for responsive styling
  • @dnd-kit for drag-and-drop functionality
  • Lucide React for beautiful icons

Backend Stack

Section titled ‚ÄúBackend Stack‚Äù
  • Python 3.10+ with Flask 3.0
  • SQLite with Flask-SQLAlchemy for data persistence
  • Google Gemini API for AI-powered generation
  • python-pptx for PPTX export
  • Pillow for image processing

  • Node.js 16+
  • uv package manager

Best Practices

Section titled ‚ÄúBest Practices‚Äù

1. Start with Clear Ideas

Section titled ‚Äú1. Start with Clear Ideas‚Äù

The clearer your initial description, the better the AI output. Be specific about:

  • Target audience
  • Key messages
  • Desired tone (professional, casual, creative)

2. Iterate with Natural Language

Section titled ‚Äú2. Iterate with Natural Language‚Äù

Don‚Äôt settle for the first output. Use natural language commands to refine:

  • ‚ÄúMake this more professional‚Äù
  • ‚ÄúSimplify the visuals‚Äù
  • ‚ÄúAdd more data visualization‚Äù

3. Leverage Template Upload

Section titled ‚Äú3. Leverage Template Upload‚Äù

For brand consistency, upload your company‚Äôs template as a reference image. Banana-Slides will maintain your brand‚Äôs visual identity.

4. Use Smart Content Parsing

Section titled ‚Äú4. Use Smart Content Parsing‚Äù

Have existing content? Upload it! Banana-Slides excels at transforming written documents into engaging presentations.

Development Roadmap

Section titled ‚ÄúDevelopment Roadmap‚Äù
StatusFeature
‚úÖ CompletedMulti-path creation, file parsing, element editing, PPTX export
üöß In ProgressElement segmentation, web search integration, Agent mode
üìã PlannedPerformance optimization, online playback, animations, multi-language support

Comparison with Alternatives

Section titled ‚ÄúComparison with Alternatives‚Äù
FeatureBanana-SlidesTraditional ToolsOther AI Tools
Natural Language Creation‚úÖ Full support‚ùå None‚ö†Ô∏è Limited
Custom Template Upload‚úÖ Any image‚ö†Ô∏è Specific formats‚ùå Rarely
Document Parsing‚úÖ Multiple formats‚ùå Manual input‚ö†Ô∏è Some formats

Self-Hosted‚úÖ Yes‚ùå No‚ùå Rarely

Community & Support

Section titled ‚ÄúCommunity & Support‚Äù
  • GitHub Repository: Anionex/banana-slides
  • Stars: 6.1k+ ‚≠ê
  • Forks: 690+
  • Active Development: Yes (239+ commits)

FAQ

Section titled ‚ÄúFAQ‚Äù

Q: What AI model does Banana-Slides use?

Section titled ‚ÄúQ: What AI model does Banana-Slides use?‚Äù

A: Banana-Slides is built on the nano banana pro üçå model, integrated with Google Gemini API for content generation.

Q: Can I use my own branding?

Section titled ‚ÄúQ: Can I use my own branding?‚Äù

A: Yes! Upload any template image, and Banana-Slides will maintain your brand‚Äôs visual consistency.

Q: Is my data safe?

Section titled ‚ÄúQ: Is my data safe?‚Äù

A: Self-hosting option ensures your data stays on your infrastructure. No data is sent to external services except the AI API calls.

Q: What formats can I upload for content parsing?

Section titled ‚ÄúQ: What formats can I upload for content parsing?‚Äù

A: PDF, DOCX, Markdown (.md), and plain text (.txt) files are supported.

Q: Can I edit the generated presentations in PowerPoint?

Section titled ‚ÄúQ: Can I edit the generated presentations in PowerPoint?‚Äù

A: Absolutely! Export to PPTX format and edit freely in any compatible application.

Conclusion

Section titled ‚ÄúConclusion‚Äù

Banana-Slides represents the future of presentation creation - where your ideas flow naturally into professional slides without the friction of traditional design tools. Its open-source nature, powerful AI capabilities, and flexible deployment options make it an excellent choice for individuals and organizations looking to streamline their presentation workflows.

Ready to revolutionize your presentation workflow? üçå

OpenSkills: Universal Skills Loader for AI Coding Agents

Dec 24, 2025
Vibe Sparking

OpenSkills: Universal Skills Loader for AI Coding Agents

Section titled ‚ÄúOpenSkills: Universal Skills Loader for AI Coding Agents‚Äù

AI coding agents have revolutionized software development, but each agent operates in its own ecosystem with unique capabilities. OpenSkills bridges this gap by bringing Anthropic‚Äôs powerful skills system to all AI coding agents.

What is OpenSkills?

Section titled ‚ÄúWhat is OpenSkills?‚Äù

OpenSkills is a universal skills loader that implements Anthropic‚Äôs Agent Skills specification for any AI coding agent. It brings Claude Code‚Äôs skills system to Cursor, Windsurf, Aider, and other agents with 100% compatibility.

Why OpenSkills Matters

Section titled ‚ÄúWhy OpenSkills Matters‚Äù

The Problem

Section titled ‚ÄúThe Problem‚Äù

Each AI coding agent has its own way of handling specialized capabilities:

  • Claude Code has a built-in skills system with marketplace
  • Cursor uses custom rules and instructions
  • Windsurf has its own knowledge management
  • Aider relies on conventions and prompts

This fragmentation means skills and workflows don‚Äôt transfer between agents.

The Solution

Section titled ‚ÄúThe Solution‚Äù

OpenSkills provides a unified skills format that works across all agents:

  • Same prompt format - <available_skills> XML structure
  • Same marketplace - Access Anthropic‚Äôs official skills
  • Same folder structure - Uses .claude/skills/ by default
  • Same SKILL.md format - YAML frontmatter + markdown instructions
  • Progressive disclosure - Load skills on demand, not upfront

Key Features

Section titled ‚ÄúKey Features‚Äù

1. Universal Compatibility

Section titled ‚Äú1. Universal Compatibility‚Äù

OpenSkills works with any AI coding agent by using CLI commands instead of proprietary tool calls:

AspectClaude CodeOpenSkills
InvocationSkill("pdf")openskills read pdf
Prompt Format<available_skills> XMLIdentical
Folder Structure.claude/skills/Identical
SKILL.md FormatYAML + markdownIdentical

2. Multiple Installation Sources

Section titled ‚Äú2. Multiple Installation Sources‚Äù

Install skills from various sources:

3. Progressive Disclosure

Section titled ‚Äú3. Progressive Disclosure‚Äù

Skills load only when needed, keeping your agent‚Äôs context clean and focused. When the agent needs a skill:

  1. Agent scans <available_skills> in AGENTS.md
  2. Agent executes openskills read <skill-name>
  3. Full skill instructions load into context
  4. Agent follows instructions to complete task

4. Bundled Resources Support

Section titled ‚Äú4. Bundled Resources Support‚Äù

Skills can include supporting resources:

Quick Start Guide

Section titled ‚ÄúQuick Start Guide‚Äù

Step 1: Install OpenSkills

Section titled ‚ÄúStep 1: Install OpenSkills‚Äù

Requires Node.js 20.6+ and Git.

Step 2: Install Skills

Section titled ‚ÄúStep 2: Install Skills‚Äù

Available skills from Anthropic‚Äôs marketplace:

  • pdf - PDF manipulation (extract, merge, split, forms)
  • xlsx - Spreadsheet creation and analysis
  • docx - Document creation with tracked changes
  • pptx - Presentation creation and editing
  • canvas-design - Create posters and visual designs
  • mcp-builder - Build Model Context Protocol servers
  • skill-creator - Guide for authoring skills

Step 3: Sync to AGENTS.md

Section titled ‚ÄúStep 3: Sync to AGENTS.md‚Äù

This updates your AGENTS.md file with the <available_skills> section:

Advanced Usage

Section titled ‚ÄúAdvanced Usage‚Äù

Global vs Project Installation

Section titled ‚ÄúGlobal vs Project Installation‚Äù

Universal Mode for Multi-Agent Setups

Section titled ‚ÄúUniversal Mode for Multi-Agent Setups‚Äù

If you use Claude Code alongside other agents:

This installs to .agent/skills/ to avoid conflicts with Claude Code‚Äôs native marketplace.

Priority order:

  1. ./.agent/skills/ (project universal)
  2. ~/.agent/skills/ (global universal)
  3. ./.claude/skills/ (project)
  4. ~/.claude/skills/ (global)

Local Development with Symlinks

Section titled ‚ÄúLocal Development with Symlinks‚Äù

For active skill development:

Creating Custom Skills

Section titled ‚ÄúCreating Custom Skills‚Äù

Minimal Structure

Section titled ‚ÄúMinimal Structure‚Äù

Full Structure with Resources

Section titled ‚ÄúFull Structure with Resources‚Äù

Publishing

Section titled ‚ÄúPublishing‚Äù
  1. Create a GitHub repository with your skill
  2. Users install with: openskills install username/repo-name

Use Cases

Section titled ‚ÄúUse Cases‚Äù

1. Standardize Skills Across Teams

Section titled ‚Äú1. Standardize Skills Across Teams‚Äù

Use OpenSkills to share skills across your organization regardless of which AI agent team members prefer:

2. Extend Claude Code‚Äôs Marketplace

Section titled ‚Äú2. Extend Claude Code‚Äôs Marketplace‚Äù

Install skills from any GitHub repository, not just Anthropic‚Äôs marketplace:

3. Private Enterprise Skills

Section titled ‚Äú3. Private Enterprise Skills‚Äù

Keep proprietary skills in private repositories:

4. Multi-Agent Workflows

Section titled ‚Äú4. Multi-Agent Workflows‚Äù

Use the same skills whether you‚Äôre in Claude Code, Cursor, or Windsurf:

Why CLI Instead of MCP?

Section titled ‚ÄúWhy CLI Instead of MCP?‚Äù

OpenSkills uses CLI commands rather than MCP (Model Context Protocol) because:

  1. Skills are static instructions - Not dynamic tools requiring server connections
  2. No server needed - Skills are just markdown files
  3. Universal compatibility - CLI works with any agent
  4. Follows Anthropic‚Äôs design - Skills were designed as SKILL.md files
  5. Simpler for users - No server management required

MCP and skills solve different problems. OpenSkills implements the skills spec as designed.

Best Practices

Section titled ‚ÄúBest Practices‚Äù

1. Keep Skills Focused

Section titled ‚Äú1. Keep Skills Focused‚Äù

Each skill should handle one specific domain. Don‚Äôt create ‚Äúdo everything‚Äù skills.

2. Write Clear Descriptions

Section titled ‚Äú2. Write Clear Descriptions‚Äù

The description helps agents decide when to load the skill:

3. Use Progressive Disclosure

Section titled ‚Äú3. Use Progressive Disclosure‚Äù

Put detailed instructions in SKILL.md, not the description. This keeps the <available_skills> section compact.

4. Include Examples

Section titled ‚Äú4. Include Examples‚Äù

Help agents understand how to use your skill with concrete examples in the instructions.

Comparison with Alternatives

Section titled ‚ÄúComparison with Alternatives‚Äù
FeatureOpenSkillsCustom PromptsMCP
UniversalYesPer-agentRequires support
Progressive LoadingYesNoYes
Marketplace AccessYesNoDifferent
Setup ComplexityLowVariesHigher
Bundled ResourcesYesLimitedYes

Conclusion

Section titled ‚ÄúConclusion‚Äù

OpenSkills democratizes AI agent skills by making Anthropic‚Äôs well-designed skills system available to all agents. Whether you‚Äôre using Claude Code, Cursor, Windsurf, or Aider, you can now benefit from:

  • Standardized skills format across agents
  • Access to Anthropic‚Äôs marketplace via GitHub
  • Progressive disclosure for clean contexts
  • Easy skill sharing within teams and communities

Get started today:

References

Section titled ‚ÄúReferences‚Äù
  • OpenSkills GitHub Repository
  • OpenSkills npm Package
  • Anthropic‚Äôs Agent Skills Blog Post
  • Anthropic Skills Marketplace (GitHub)
  • Follow @nummanali on X

  • AI
  • OpenSkills

  • Skills

  • Windsurf
  • Aider
  • Agent Skills
  • Progressive Disclosure

SkillsMP: The Open Marketplace for AI Agent Skills

Dec 24, 2025
Vibe Sparking

SkillsMP: The Open Marketplace for AI Agent Skills

Section titled ‚ÄúSkillsMP: The Open Marketplace for AI Agent Skills‚Äù

AI coding assistants have become indispensable tools for developers, but their capabilities are often limited to what comes built-in. SkillsMP changes this by providing an open marketplace where developers can discover, install, and share skills across multiple AI platforms.

What is SkillsMP?

Section titled ‚ÄúWhat is SkillsMP?‚Äù

SkillsMP is an open-source marketplace hosting over 31,000 agent skills that work seamlessly with the most popular AI coding assistants:

  • Claude Code - Anthropic‚Äôs official CLI tool
  • Codex CLI - OpenAI‚Äôs command-line interface
  • ChatGPT - The world‚Äôs most popular AI assistant

All skills use the unified SKILL.md format, ensuring compatibility across platforms and making it easy to share capabilities between different AI tools.

The SKILL.md Standard

Section titled ‚ÄúThe SKILL.md Standard‚Äù

The SKILL.md format is the foundation of the agent skills ecosystem. It defines modular capabilities through:

  • Instructions - Clear guidance for the AI on what the skill does and how to use it
  • Scripts (optional) - Supporting code that extends functionality
  • Templates (optional) - Pre-built structures for common outputs

Key Characteristics

Section titled ‚ÄúKey Characteristics‚Äù

Skills are model-invoked, not user-invoked. This means the AI assistant decides when to activate a skill based on the context of your request, rather than requiring explicit commands.

Installation Paths

Section titled ‚ÄúInstallation Paths‚Äù

Different AI tools have their own skill directories:

ToolPersonal SkillsProject Skills
Claude Code~/.claude/skills/.claude/skills/
Codex CLI~/.codex/skills/.codex/skills/
ChatGPTVia plugin systemVia plugin system

Skill Categories

Section titled ‚ÄúSkill Categories‚Äù

SkillsMP organizes its vast library into 13 categories:

  1. Tools - General productivity enhancers
  2. Development - Code generation and refactoring
  3. Data & AI - Data analysis and ML utilities
  4. Business - Business process automation
  5. DevOps - Infrastructure and deployment
  6. Testing & Security - QA and security scanning
  7. Documentation - Docs generation and maintenance
  8. Content & Media - Content creation tools
  9. Lifestyle - Personal productivity
  10. Research - Information gathering
  11. Databases - Database operations
  12. Blockchain - Web3 and crypto tools

Quality Standards

Section titled ‚ÄúQuality Standards‚Äù

SkillsMP maintains quality through:

  • Minimum 2-star filter - Only GitHub repos with community validation
  • Open-source requirement - All skills are publicly auditable
  • User review recommended - Always review code before installation

Using SkillsMP

Section titled ‚ÄúUsing SkillsMP‚Äù

Browsing Skills

Section titled ‚ÄúBrowsing Skills‚Äù

Visit skillsmp.com to browse the marketplace. You can:

  • Search by keyword
  • Filter by category
  • Sort by popularity or recency
  • View skill documentation

Installing Skills

Section titled ‚ÄúInstalling Skills‚Äù

For Claude Code, installation is straightforward:

Many skills also support one-command installation via their marketplace.json configuration.

Multiple Skill Execution

Section titled ‚ÄúMultiple Skill Execution‚Äù

Claude Code supports running multiple skills simultaneously. The AI intelligently selects which skills to activate based on context, enabling complex workflows that combine several capabilities.

Creating Custom Skills

Section titled ‚ÄúCreating Custom Skills‚Äù

Want to contribute to the marketplace? Creating a skill requires just a SKILL.md file:

Publishing to Marketplace

Section titled ‚ÄúPublishing to Marketplace‚Äù
  1. Create a GitHub repository with your skill
  2. Add a marketplace.json for easy installation
  3. Submit to SkillsMP for indexing

Independence and Official Resources

Section titled ‚ÄúIndependence and Official Resources‚Äù

Important: SkillsMP is an independent community project. It is not affiliated with Anthropic or OpenAI.

For official skill resources:

  • Anthropic‚Äôs Official Skills: github.com/anthropics/skills
  • OpenAI‚Äôs Documentation: platform.openai.com

Best Practices

Section titled ‚ÄúBest Practices‚Äù

For Users

Section titled ‚ÄúFor Users‚Äù
  1. Review before installing - Always check the source code
  2. Start with popular skills - Higher stars indicate community trust
  3. Keep skills updated - Check for updates regularly
  4. Report issues - Help improve the ecosystem

For Skill Creators

Section titled ‚ÄúFor Skill Creators‚Äù
  1. Write clear descriptions - Help users understand when to use your skill
  2. Include examples - Show concrete use cases
  3. Document thoroughly - Explain all features and limitations
  4. Test across platforms - Ensure compatibility

The Future of AI Agent Skills

Section titled ‚ÄúThe Future of AI Agent Skills‚Äù

The standardization around SKILL.md represents a significant shift in how we extend AI capabilities. As more developers create and share skills:

  • Specialization increases - Skills become more focused and powerful
  • Quality improves - Community curation drives excellence
  • Adoption grows - Easy installation removes barriers
  • Innovation accelerates - Building on others‚Äô work speeds development

Conclusion

Section titled ‚ÄúConclusion‚Äù

SkillsMP democratizes access to AI agent capabilities by providing:

  • 31,000+ ready-to-use skills across 13 categories
  • Cross-platform compatibility via the SKILL.md standard
  • Open-source transparency with community quality control
  • Easy installation for all major AI coding assistants

Whether you‚Äôre looking to enhance your AI coding workflow or contribute your own skills to the community, SkillsMP provides the platform to make it happen.

References

Section titled ‚ÄúReferences‚Äù
  • SkillsMP Marketplace
  • Anthropic Official Skills Repository
  • Anthropic‚Äôs Agent Skills Blog Post
  • OpenAI Platform Documentation

  • AI Marketplace

Agent Skills for Context Engineering: Build Production-Grade AI Agent Systems

Dec 24, 2025
Vibe Sparking

Agent Skills for Context Engineering: Build Production-Grade AI Agent Systems

Section titled ‚ÄúAgent Skills for Context Engineering: Build Production-Grade AI Agent Systems‚Äù

In the rapidly evolving landscape of AI development, context engineering has emerged as one of the most critical disciplines for building effective agent systems. Unlike prompt engineering, which focuses on crafting effective instructions, context engineering addresses the holistic curation of all information entering a model‚Äôs limited attention window.

Agent Skills for Context Engineering by Murat Can Koylan is a comprehensive, open-source collection designed to teach the art and science of curating context to maximize agent effectiveness across any platform.

What is Context Engineering?

Section titled ‚ÄúWhat is Context Engineering?‚Äù

Context engineering is the discipline of managing the language model‚Äôs context window. The fundamental challenge is that context windows are constrained not by raw token capacity but by attention mechanics.

The Core Problem

Section titled ‚ÄúThe Core Problem‚Äù

As context length increases, models exhibit predictable degradation patterns:

  • Lost-in-the-Middle Phenomenon - Information in the middle of long contexts gets less attention
  • U-Shaped Attention Curves - Models focus more on beginning and end of context
  • Attention Scarcity - Limited ‚Äúattention budget‚Äù must be allocated wisely

The Solution

Section titled ‚ÄúThe Solution‚Äù

Effective context engineering means finding the smallest possible set of high-signal tokens that maximize the likelihood of desired outcomes. This requires understanding what context is, how it degrades, and how to optimize it.

Skills Overview

Section titled ‚ÄúSkills Overview‚Äù

The collection is organized into three tiers of increasing complexity.

Foundational Skills

Section titled ‚ÄúFoundational Skills‚Äù

These skills establish the foundational understanding required for all subsequent context engineering work.

SkillDescription
context-fundamentalsUnderstand what context is, why it matters, and the anatomy of context in agent systems
context-degradationRecognize patterns of context failure: lost-in-middle, poisoning, distraction, and clash
context-compressionDesign and evaluate compression strategies for long-running sessions

Architectural Skills

Section titled ‚ÄúArchitectural Skills‚Äù

These skills cover the patterns and structures for building effective agent systems.

SkillDescription
multi-agent-patternsMaster orchestrator, peer-to-peer, and hierarchical multi-agent architectures
memory-systemsDesign short-term, long-term, and graph-based memory architectures
tool-designBuild tools that agents can use effectively

Operational Skills

Section titled ‚ÄúOperational Skills‚Äù

These skills address the ongoing operation and optimization of agent systems.

SkillDescription
context-optimizationApply compaction, masking, and caching strategies
evaluationBuild evaluation frameworks for agent systems

Key Concepts Deep Dive

Section titled ‚ÄúKey Concepts Deep Dive‚Äù

1. Context Fundamentals

Section titled ‚Äú1. Context Fundamentals‚Äù

Understanding the anatomy of context in agent systems is essential:

Components of Context:

  • System prompts
  • Tool definitions
  • Retrieved documents
  • Message history
  • Tool outputs

Each component competes for limited attention. Effective agents prioritize high-signal information and compress or eliminate low-signal content.

2. Context Degradation Patterns

Section titled ‚Äú2. Context Degradation Patterns‚Äù

Recognizing failure patterns helps prevent them:

Lost-in-Middle: Critical information placed in the middle of long contexts receives less model attention.

Context Poisoning: Bad or conflicting information corrupts the model‚Äôs understanding.

Context Distraction: Irrelevant information diverts attention from important content.

Context Clash: Contradictory instructions or data create confusion.

3. Multi-Agent Patterns

Section titled ‚Äú3. Multi-Agent Patterns‚Äù

Three primary architectures for multi-agent systems:

Orchestrator Pattern: A central agent coordinates specialized sub-agents, managing task delegation and result aggregation.

Peer-to-Peer Pattern: Agents communicate directly without central coordination, suitable for collaborative tasks.

Hierarchical Pattern: Layered agent structures where higher-level agents manage groups of lower-level agents.

4. Memory Systems

Section titled ‚Äú4. Memory Systems‚Äù

Effective agents require multiple memory types:

Short-term Memory:

  • Recent conversation context
  • Current task state
  • Immediate working memory

Long-term Memory:

  • Persistent knowledge stores
  • User preferences
  • Historical patterns

Graph-based Memory:

  • Relationship maps between concepts
  • Entity connections
  • Semantic networks

Installation and Usage

Section titled ‚ÄúInstallation and Usage‚Äù

For Claude Code

Section titled ‚ÄúFor Claude Code‚Äù

Install skills by referencing the repository or copying skill folders into your configured skills directory:

When working on context engineering tasks, activate relevant skills to load their instructions.

For Cursor

Section titled ‚ÄúFor Cursor‚Äù

Copy skill content into .cursorrules or create project-specific rules files:

The skills provide the context and guidelines that Cursor‚Äôs agent needs for effective context engineering.

For Custom Implementations

Section titled ‚ÄúFor Custom Implementations‚Äù

Extract the principles and patterns from any skill and implement them in your agent framework. The skills are deliberately platform-agnostic, making them applicable to any LLM-based system.

Recommended Use Scenarios

Section titled ‚ÄúRecommended Use Scenarios‚Äù

1. Building Production Agent Systems

Section titled ‚Äú1. Building Production Agent Systems‚Äù

When developing agents for real-world deployment:

  • Start with fundamentals - Understand context anatomy before optimization
  • Design memory early - Memory architecture affects all downstream decisions
  • Plan for degradation - Build in monitoring and recovery mechanisms
  • Test at scale - Evaluation frameworks catch issues before production

2. Optimizing Existing Agents

Section titled ‚Äú2. Optimizing Existing Agents‚Äù

For teams with existing agent systems:

  • Diagnose context issues - Use degradation patterns to identify problems
  • Apply compression strategies - Reduce token usage without losing signal
  • Implement caching - Avoid redundant context loading
  • Add instrumentation - Build visibility into context usage

3. Multi-Agent Architecture Design

Section titled ‚Äú3. Multi-Agent Architecture Design‚Äù

When building systems with multiple coordinating agents:

  • Choose the right pattern - Orchestrator vs peer-to-peer vs hierarchical
  • Design communication protocols - How agents share context
  • Manage shared memory - Coordination without conflicts
  • Handle failures gracefully - Recovery when agents fail

4. Educational and Training Purposes

Section titled ‚Äú4. Educational and Training Purposes‚Äù

For learning about agent development:

  • Progressive disclosure - Skills build on each other logically
  • Practical examples - Python pseudocode demonstrates concepts
  • Platform-agnostic - Learn principles, not vendor lock-in
  • Open source - Study, modify, and contribute

Daily Workflow Examples

Section titled ‚ÄúDaily Workflow Examples‚Äù

Morning Context Review

Section titled ‚ÄúMorning Context Review‚Äù

New Agent Development

Section titled ‚ÄúNew Agent Development‚Äù

Debugging Agent Issues

Section titled ‚ÄúDebugging Agent Issues‚Äù

Best Practices

Section titled ‚ÄúBest Practices‚Äù

Design Philosophy

Section titled ‚ÄúDesign Philosophy‚Äù

The collection follows three key principles:

1. Progressive Disclosure

Each skill is structured for efficient context use. At startup, agents load only skill names and descriptions. Full content loads only when a skill is activated for relevant tasks.

2. Platform Agnosticism

These skills focus on transferable principles rather than vendor-specific implementations. The patterns work across Claude Code, Cursor, and any agent platform that supports skills or allows custom instructions.

3. Conceptual Foundation with Practical Examples

Scripts and examples demonstrate concepts using Python pseudocode that works across environments without requiring specific dependency installations.

Skill Structure

Section titled ‚ÄúSkill Structure‚Äù

Each skill follows the Agent Skills specification:

Contributing Guidelines

Section titled ‚ÄúContributing Guidelines‚Äù

When contributing new skills:

  1. Follow the skill template structure
  2. Provide clear, actionable instructions
  3. Include working examples where appropriate
  4. Document trade-offs and potential issues
  5. Keep SKILL.md under 500 lines for optimal performance

Comparison with Alternatives

Section titled ‚ÄúComparison with Alternatives‚Äù
FeatureAgent SkillsCustom RulesFramework Docs
Platform SupportAnyPlatform-specificFramework-specific
FocusContext engineeringGeneralFramework usage
StructureStandardizedVariableVariable
Progressive LoadingYesNoNo
Open SourceMITVariesVaries
ExamplesPython pseudocodeVariesFramework-specific

Why Agent Skills?

Section titled ‚ÄúWhy Agent Skills?‚Äù

vs. Custom Rules:

  • Standardized structure enables sharing and reuse
  • Progressive disclosure reduces initial context cost
  • Community contributions expand coverage

vs. Framework Documentation:

  • Focuses on principles, not implementation details
  • Transferable across platforms
  • Practical orientation for production systems

Troubleshooting and FAQ

Section titled ‚ÄúTroubleshooting and FAQ‚Äù

Common Questions

Section titled ‚ÄúCommon Questions‚Äù

Q: Do these skills work with any LLM? A: Yes, the principles are LLM-agnostic. Examples use Python pseudocode that can be adapted to any environment.

Q: How do I know which skill to use? A: Start with fundamentals, then move to architectural skills for design decisions, and operational skills for optimization.

Q: Can I contribute new skills? A: Absolutely! Follow the template structure and submit pull requests. Community contributions are welcome.

Q: Are there costs associated with using these skills? A: No, the repository is MIT licensed. However, the LLMs you use with these skills may have associated costs.

Q: How do skills handle context limits? A: Progressive disclosure means only relevant content loads. Each skill is designed to stay under 500 lines.

Troubleshooting

Section titled ‚ÄúTroubleshooting‚Äù

Skills not loading:

  • Ensure skill folder structure is correct
  • Check that SKILL.md exists in skill directory
  • Verify file permissions

Poor agent performance:

  • Review context-degradation skill for diagnostic patterns
  • Check if context window is being exceeded
  • Evaluate information signal-to-noise ratio

Multi-agent coordination issues:

  • Review multi-agent-patterns skill
  • Check message passing protocols
  • Verify shared memory access patterns

Reference Links

Section titled ‚ÄúReference Links‚Äù
  • GitHub Repository: muratcankoylan/Agent-Skills-for-Context-Engineering
  • Skill Template: Template folder in repository
  • Examples: X-to-Book System example
  • Agent Skills Specification: Follow repository for updates

Conclusion

Section titled ‚ÄúConclusion‚Äù

Context engineering is becoming as fundamental to AI development as software engineering principles are to traditional development. Agent Skills for Context Engineering provides a structured, open, and platform-agnostic foundation for mastering this critical discipline.

Whether you‚Äôre building your first agent or optimizing production multi-agent systems, these skills offer the conceptual foundation and practical guidance needed for success. The progressive disclosure design means you can start small and expand as needed, while the platform-agnostic approach ensures your learning transfers across tools and frameworks.

The AI agent ecosystem is maturing rapidly, and context engineering will be a key differentiator between agents that work and agents that work well. Start with the fundamentals, understand degradation patterns, and build systems that manage context effectively.

Explore the full collection at Agent Skills for Context Engineering and join the community building better agent systems.

Tags:
  • AI
  • Agent Skills
  • Context Engineering
  • Multi-Agent
  • Claude Code
  • Cursor
  • LLM
  • Production Systems

Google Code Wiki: AI-Powered Documentation That Evolves With Your Code

Dec 23, 2025
Vibe Sparking

Google Code Wiki: AI-Powered Documentation That Evolves With Your Code

Section titled ‚ÄúGoogle Code Wiki: AI-Powered Documentation That Evolves With Your Code‚Äù

In November 2025, Google introduced Code Wiki, a revolutionary platform that addresses one of software development‚Äôs most persistent challenges: keeping documentation synchronized with code. Powered by Gemini AI, Code Wiki automatically generates and maintains comprehensive, always-up-to-date documentation for any code repository.

What is Google Code Wiki?

Section titled ‚ÄúWhat is Google Code Wiki?‚Äù

Code Wiki is a new platform designed for the agentic era of software development. It maintains a continuously updated, structured wiki for code repositories, automatically regenerating documentation after every code change.

‚ÄúA new perspective on development for the agentic era. Gemini-generated documentation, always up-to-date.‚Äù

The Documentation Problem

Section titled ‚ÄúThe Documentation Problem‚Äù

Reading and understanding existing code is one of the biggest, most expensive bottlenecks in software development. Traditional documentation:

  • Gets outdated quickly - Code changes faster than docs can be updated
  • Lacks context - Static docs don‚Äôt explain relationships between components
  • Requires manual effort - Engineers spend time writing docs instead of coding
  • Becomes inconsistent - Different authors, different styles, incomplete coverage

Code Wiki solves these problems through automated, AI-powered documentation generation.

Core Features & Highlights

Section titled ‚ÄúCore Features & Highlights‚Äù

1. Automatic Documentation Generation

Section titled ‚Äú1. Automatic Documentation Generation‚Äù

Code Wiki scans entire repositories and generates structured documentation automatically:

  • Full codebase analysis - Understands all files, functions, and relationships
  • Regeneration on every commit - Docs update automatically with each change
  • Architecture diagrams - Visual representations generated and kept current
  • Class and sequence diagrams - Technical visualizations for complex systems

2. Gemini-Powered Chat Interface

Section titled ‚Äú2. Gemini-Powered Chat Interface‚Äù

Each Code Wiki page includes an intelligent chat agent:

  • Context-aware Q&A - Ask specific questions about YOUR codebase
  • Full wiki knowledge - Chat uses the complete, current documentation as context
  • Direct code links - Answers include hyperlinks to relevant source files
  • Natural language queries - Ask questions in plain English

Example interactions:

  • ‚ÄúHow does the authentication module work?‚Äù
  • ‚ÄúWhat functions call the database connection pool?‚Äù
  • ‚ÄúExplain the data flow in the payment processing system‚Äù

3. Hyperlinked Navigation

Section titled ‚Äú3. Hyperlinked Navigation‚Äù

Every documentation element connects directly to source code:

  • Symbol linking - Click any function, class, or variable to see its definition
  • Cross-references - Navigate between related concepts seamlessly
  • File locations - Know exactly where code lives
  • Definition chains - Trace from high-level concepts to implementation details

4. Powered by NotebookLM

Section titled ‚Äú4. Powered by NotebookLM‚Äù

Code Wiki integrates with Google‚Äôs NotebookLM for enhanced documentation:

  • Video explanations - Auto-generated video walkthroughs of codebases
  • Interactive presentations - Architecture overviews with multimedia
  • Audio summaries - Listen to code explanations (coming soon)

Prerequisites & Getting Started

Section titled ‚ÄúPrerequisites & Getting Started‚Äù

Accessing Code Wiki

Section titled ‚ÄúAccessing Code Wiki‚Äù

Public Preview (Available Now):

  1. Visit codewiki.google
  2. Search for any public open-source repository
  3. Code Wiki generates documentation automatically

Supported Repositories:

  • GitHub public repositories
  • GitLab public projects
  • Bitbucket public repos

Featured Repositories

Section titled ‚ÄúFeatured Repositories‚Äù

Code Wiki showcases documentation for popular projects:

RepositoryStarsDescription
gemini-cli81.5kOpen-source AI agent for terminal
go130.7kThe Go programming language
flutter173.7kBuild beautiful apps for mobile
kubernetes118.4kContainer orchestration platform
react240.3kWeb and native UI library
python-sdk19.8kMCP Python SDK

Gemini CLI Extension (Coming Soon)

Section titled ‚ÄúGemini CLI Extension (Coming Soon)‚Äù

For private repositories, Google is developing a Gemini CLI extension:

  • Local deployment - Keep sensitive code on your infrastructure
  • Enterprise security - Meets compliance requirements
  • Legacy codebase support - Perfect for undocumented systems
  • Join the waitlist at codewiki.google

Recommended Use Cases

Section titled ‚ÄúRecommended Use Cases‚Äù

1. Onboarding New Team Members

Section titled ‚Äú1. Onboarding New Team Members‚Äù

Code Wiki dramatically accelerates developer onboarding:

Before Code Wiki:

  • 2-4 weeks to understand codebase structure
  • Constant questions to senior developers
  • Reading outdated documentation
  • Trial-and-error exploration

With Code Wiki:

  • Understand system architecture in minutes
  • Ask specific questions, get accurate answers
  • Self-service exploration with chat assistant
  • Meaningful contributions on day one

2. Understanding Legacy Codebases

Section titled ‚Äú2. Understanding Legacy Codebases‚Äù

For teams inheriting undocumented systems:

  • Automatic documentation - Generate docs for any codebase
  • Architecture discovery - See how components interact
  • Dependency mapping - Understand what connects to what
  • Knowledge preservation - Capture institutional knowledge

3. Code Reviews and Audits

Section titled ‚Äú3. Code Reviews and Audits‚Äù

Streamline review processes:

  • Quick context - Reviewers understand changes faster
  • Impact analysis - See what code connects to modified areas
  • Consistent understanding - Everyone reads the same docs
  • Security audits - Faster codebase comprehension

4. Open Source Exploration

Section titled ‚Äú4. Open Source Exploration‚Äù

Evaluate and learn from open source projects:

  • Rapid evaluation - Understand projects before adopting
  • Learning tool - See how major projects are structured
  • Contribution prep - Understand codebase before contributing
  • Pattern discovery - Learn architectural approaches

Daily Workflow Examples

Section titled ‚ÄúDaily Workflow Examples‚Äù

Developer Morning Routine

Section titled ‚ÄúDeveloper Morning Routine‚Äù

New Feature Development

Section titled ‚ÄúNew Feature Development‚Äù

Debugging Workflow

Section titled ‚ÄúDebugging Workflow‚Äù

Best Practices

Section titled ‚ÄúBest Practices‚Äù

Maximizing Code Wiki Value

Section titled ‚ÄúMaximizing Code Wiki Value‚Äù
  1. Use specific questions - ‚ÄúHow does X work?‚Äù beats ‚ÄúTell me about the code‚Äù
  2. Follow hyperlinks - Navigate from docs to code for verification
  3. Refresh regularly - Check for updated docs after team commits
  4. Combine with IDE - Keep Code Wiki open alongside your editor

For Team Leads

Section titled ‚ÄúFor Team Leads‚Äù
  1. Share wiki links - Point team members to relevant sections
  2. Standardize onboarding - Include Code Wiki in new hire checklist
  3. Reference in reviews - Use wiki links in PR discussions
  4. Monitor coverage - Identify areas needing better documentation

Comparison with Alternatives

Section titled ‚ÄúComparison with Alternatives‚Äù
FeatureCode WikiReadMeDocusaurusGitBook
Auto-generationYes (Gemini)ManualManualManual
Real-time updatesEvery commitManualManualManual
AI chat assistantYesNoNoNo
Diagram generationAutomaticManualManualManual
Code linkingAutomaticManualManualManual
Setup requiredNoneConfigurationFull setupConfiguration
Private reposComing soonYesYesYes

Advantages Over Traditional Documentation

Section titled ‚ÄúAdvantages Over Traditional Documentation‚Äù

vs. Manual Documentation:

  • No maintenance overhead
  • Always current
  • Consistent formatting
  • Complete coverage

vs. Code Comments:

  • Higher-level understanding
  • Cross-file relationships
  • Visual diagrams
  • Searchable and navigable

vs. README files:

  • Comprehensive depth
  • Interactive chat
  • Auto-updated
  • Architecture views

FAQ & Troubleshooting

Section titled ‚ÄúFAQ & Troubleshooting‚Äù

Frequently Asked Questions

Section titled ‚ÄúFrequently Asked Questions‚Äù

Q: Is Code Wiki free? A: Public preview for open-source repos is free. Private repo pricing TBD.

Q: How quickly does documentation update? A: Documentation regenerates after each commit, typically within minutes.

Q: Can I customize the generated documentation? A: Currently documentation is fully automated. Custom templates may come later.

Q: Does Code Wiki support all programming languages? A: Gemini AI supports most popular languages. Quality may vary for niche languages.

Q: Is my code sent to Google‚Äôs servers? A: For public repos, yes. The CLI extension for private repos will enable local processing.

Q: Can I export the documentation? A: Export features are on the roadmap. Currently, documentation lives on codewiki.google.

Troubleshooting

Section titled ‚ÄúTroubleshooting‚Äù

Documentation not appearing:

  • Verify the repository is public
  • Check that the repo URL is correct
  • Wait a few minutes for initial generation

Chat not responding:

  • Refresh the page
  • Try a more specific question
  • Check your network connection

Diagrams missing:

  • Complex repos may take longer to process
  • Some architectural patterns may not visualize well
  • Check back after a few minutes

Reference Links

Section titled ‚ÄúReference Links‚Äù
  • Official Site: codewiki.google
  • Google Developers Blog: Introducing Code Wiki
  • Gemini CLI Waitlist: Available at codewiki.google
  • NotebookLM: notebooklm.google

Conclusion

Section titled ‚ÄúConclusion‚Äù

Google Code Wiki represents a fundamental shift in how we approach code documentation. By leveraging Gemini AI to automatically generate and maintain comprehensive, always-current documentation, Code Wiki eliminates one of software development‚Äôs most persistent pain points.

For open-source projects, the public preview is available now. For enterprise teams with private codebases, the upcoming Gemini CLI extension promises the same benefits with local deployment and security compliance.

Whether you‚Äôre onboarding new developers, exploring unfamiliar codebases, or simply wanting to understand how your own code works, Code Wiki provides an intelligent, always-updated companion for your development journey.

Try Code Wiki today at codewiki.google and experience the future of code documentation.
